org.cruk.genologics.api.http

Class GenologicsFailureResponseErrorHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.web.client.DefaultResponseErrorHandler
      • org.cruk.genologics.api.http.GenologicsFailureResponseErrorHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResponseErrorHandler

    public class GenologicsFailureResponseErrorHandler
extends DefaultResponseErrorHandler
    REST client error handler that looks at the response body when there is a failure code (an HTTP 400 or 500 code) and sees if the body contains a Genologics exception message. If it does, that is thrown instead.

    This handler relies on the exception conversion aspect around the JAXB2 unmarshaller.

    See Also:
    GenologicsExceptionAspect

      protected boolean hasError(HttpStatus statusCode)
      Refinement of the default implementation, as we want anything that's not a successful error code (in the 200 series) to be classed as a failure.

        Returns:

      • handleError

        public void handleError(ClientHttpResponse response)
                 throws IOException
        See if the response indicates an error and, if the body of the response is a Genologics error reply, create a throwable GenologicsException from it and throw that.

        Normally this test should be redundant, as the GenologicsExceptionAspect should automatically take care of creating throwable GenologicsExceptions from the response.

        Specified by:
        handleError in interface ResponseErrorHandler
        Overrides:
        handleError in class DefaultResponseErrorHandler
        Parameters:
        response - The HTTP response.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading from the response.
        GenologicsException - if the response is found to be a Genologics exception.
        See Also:
        GenologicsExceptionAspect
